reviews.review_msg: Funny, knowledgable and approachable. Dr. Bains made biology cool. Now I am taking his BISC 101 class because of how intersting the topics are (and yes, I have a greater appreciation of plants!). If you have not done so, take a class with him. You will not regret it!!!!
Perfect introductory course for ppl without any biology background.

Briscoe was one of the rare great proffs in SFU in my opinion. His lectures were fascinating, I always looked forward to attending it! His exams were not hard, but challenging, as long as you truly understands the notes in detail the exams should be a piece of cake ;) He was the most responsible proff I've had, he made sure you understood crystal c
He is definitely one of the best professors. His exams can be tough but if you do the tutorial questions and keep up with the lecture materials, you will do fine. High recommended!

He is a nice guy and he tries to be helpful. However, I didn't find the exams fair and he is a tough marker. I think he expects way more from the students than what we can actually do, especially the ones who are not science majors. In my opinion, he should change his testing style.
Just like another mediocre instructor. Show up and pass. (However, the lab provided by another instructor contains tons of attendance and pre-works, not very pleasant experience.)
Gives extremely hard exams
Mala is one of the best Profs I've ever had She is though let students to think critically is very helpfu. Very inspirational Love to take more classes from her

I found Mala to be a dedicated and inspiring instructor. She cares about how students learn and explores different ways of teaching. While she would run into technical issues frequently, her lectures were engaging and I looked forward to them! I had zero problems with her accent. If you don't pay attention and you don't work hard, you'll struggle.

I just took BISC 100 with Mala. She's a nice person, she's approachable, and she seems to have a positive attitude most of the time. However SFU doesn't pay her to be a nice person. I would say she is not a good prof. She made simple topics confusing, she was unorganized, and she did a horrible job at preparing us for the exams.

Mala has definitely been an inspiration! She is just so passionate about what she does, and that motivated me! She has an accent that might make the lecture harder to understand, but her helpfulness and passion make up for that! Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had! Highly recommend her class!

The best prof I have had at SFU by far. She is very knowledgable and passionate in the field of biology with a great sense of humour. Her exams are very true to the textbook material and you will get a lot out of her lectures. The difficult of the course is not hard but not easy. A+ quality PHD prof, take her if you to get the most out of bio.

Her class provides a good learning environment, and she is extremely helpful, and if she is unclear, the TAs can help. She is very committed to her career, and loves what she does, and loves teaching. I sometimes use her as a fashion role model. In addition, her labs are good for learning. She has inspired me to become a biologist.
She is a very nice lady...she is sometimes hard to understand!!! i recommend her she scales the course very high. I had a C+ and i got a B
She is really nice. I had her for lab, she really loves what she does. Sometimes her accent is a little hard to understand... but she is easy to talk to and answers questions.

One onf the best lecturer ever, she is very helpful and she is full of knowledge, her slides were organized neatly, easy to understand. The TA would be very helpful if you have problem understanding her words.

Mala was an excellent teacher! Even though her accent is kind of tough at times, she really knows her stuff! I would DEFINATELY take another class with her because she really cares about her students. Large lab sizes aren't her fault! I thought the labs went a long way in helping me understand stuf the text was sparse on...

she's a very sweet. she tries to be active with students. her lecture slides are easy to follow. she's fair with the midterms.. but the lab exams and the final exam were always a lot harder than the mock ones she gives us as practice.

I really liked her but her accent made it hard to understand. I found that she was awesome with one on one help, but with such a huge lab size, it was hard to get that much time with her. Without that one on one help, I felt like I was drowning in terms... a little overwhelming.
heavy accent, but nice, helpful and SO FUNNY! The final was really easy.

Nice enough lady, very helpful in a one-on-one situation (like in lab), but very difficult to understand in lecture.  Quite disorganized (she usually showed up to class at least 5-10 min, she was even late to the final)  Exams were quite challenging and questions were often worded in a way that was hard to understand.
super nice, but i can not understand a word she says. her accent is very thick.

This women needs to be let go. I sure she is a great biologist, just not a teacher. Her English is very poor, and she expects you to know the text back and forth. Thats fine if yur 3rd or 4th year in Biology, you should know your stuff. I wouldn't take anoughter class from her ever.
Mala is a sweet lady. However, the lab exams were very difficult, specially the second, included material that was explained in the lab very quickly. the tutorials, were not very helpful either.
She is good at explaining questions. The exams are fair and not so hard.
good teacher tests are fair, and her power points are excellent.

Her lab handouts are rough and unclear; she assumes BISC100 students being more advanced. Lab stations are scarce and are ALWAYS crowded; not all students get to participate fully due to the lack of lab stations. Inferior lab handouts, unclear speaking, and incompetent lab materials and preparation
Mala is passionate towards biology. Though, her effort doesn't show in her teachings and that is reflected in the amount of people failing her lab exams.

i cant hear what she says in class.  Combine that with the long prelab talks makes her labs boring and repetitive.  she shouldn't be teaching if she can't speak proper english.  her exams are difficult.  u gotta know almost every little details.
Hardworking. Very organized powerpoint. Hard but fair exams.
very nice, very helpful, enthusiastic about teaching and the material. fair(and in fact relatively easy) exams. fun lab.
She tries her best to help the students and make them understand the materials, just that it is very hard to understand what she's saying with her heavy accent.
So nice.  Sometimes a bit hard to understand her.  She's hilarious...if you're quick enough to catch her jokes. She's great in the lab.  She loves to explain things if you ask.  She loves Biology.
BAD PROF very unforturate to have her. extremely hard exam.can't undastand
Couldn't understand a single word she says..be prepared to read your text
No Comments
hard to understand unless you listen carefully, and really helpful if you do

Excellent prof, very helpful, easy to talk to:).Loves biology and puts alot of effort into her teaching. The only q's she answered with "I don't know" were ones that were off-topic(crazy right?lol).Goes through alot of material so attend lecs AND labs as she clarifies what she wants you to know - applied q's on exams are the most difficult.
I wasn't sure what to expect in my first university science course, but Nicole made it a great experience. She is a lovely professor.
This is the best professor I have had. She tries her best to teach this course. Very nice!
He is a good prof but be ready to watch all his Youtube videos and you also have to do weekly homework. Though he will help you a lot a rectify all your mistakes and will clearify all the doubts!!!!
Teach you all the easy things then give really difficult question... eventhough he lets you bring 2 pages A4 cheat sheet... Not things in the cheat sheet will be use ��
The best!!! She is so enthusiastic about her teaching and her exams were very fair. She's also super accessible and always happy to help, I'm sad she won't be teaching at SFU anymore :(
The absolute best. She explains everything to you like a smart friend (she is a very smart friend).
She is amazing, clearly explains everything, and answers questions thoughtfully. The lab exam was really fair, you just have to go to labs and read through results.

she talks a lot and it puts ppl to sleep but still, shes super nice n she valid

lab exam is pretty free if u just study the labs and know the stuff

We do have a textbook but you really don't need it with Yvonne, she explain every things on the lecture note powerpoint, and the lectures are fun and easy to understand. No homework, only midterm and final, 2 midterm and 2 final, one for lecture contents one for lab contents, both quite straighforward. And 10% tutorial attendence.

Yvonne is a great professor, very friendly and makes biology fun. She is very inspiring and always full of energy. Her classes are really engaging and content is easy to follow and very well represented.

Fair amount of work expected, but she had a hard time communicating the material clearly and efficiently. We were rushing through the last chapter during the last lecture. Make sure you do the weekly tutorial questions as each exam is heavily based on these!

Carol is VERY knowledgeable. She is very approachable and will explain things if you are confused. She really needs to work on her communication skills. Some exam questions were extremely confusing and often needed a lot of clarification. Overall, there is a lot of material but if you put your work in, you can get a good mark.

She's an EXCELLENT prof.Studying the notes alone got me an A+.Her explanations are perfectly clear and she's very patient and makes sure that you get the material.She doesn't post her slides so you have to attend the lectures but its 100% worth it.She prepares you very well for the next Bio courses.

Yep, she's as nice as everyone says she is; Tammy's very approachable and helpful. I usually stayed behind a little in lab because I didn't get something and she patiently went over things with me. And you can pay attention to what she's saying and write at the same time. She gives you time to write and asks if you need more time.

Tammy is a GREAT teacher! She is extremely helpful, and very knowledgable in Biology. If you are going to take a Bio course, enroll in one that Tammy is teaching or doing the lab component for! She is super nice and super smart! I absolutely loved her!
GREAT lab teacher.  Always took the time to cover the complicated topics with the students, and cared very much about everyone's success.  A+!
No Comments

she was the best lab instructer!!!! i am an arts student who cant do bio to save her soul!! i spent hours with her in her office - if it werent for her i wouldn't have passed! shes very compassionate and made my bio experience less painful. thanks tammy!
Difficult class, but if you do the work you will be alright. Prof. is OK. Lectures a little boring. The tests, both mid term and final were quite hard.
This guy just reads of overheads, had the flu or something the whole semester, and taught me NOTHING.  Thank god the textbook was there...

She cares about students, and if you don't understand something, come and ask her; she will try to explain it. Even though she requires you to watch her videos at home, it helps you memorize the lecture notes in detail (active studying). Remember what she says in class (tutorials and labs) and during the field trips; she'll include it in the exam

She can communicate well, she gets across ideas fluidly. I emailed her several times and got responses within 24 hours. If you are in her class, utilize the feedback that she gives you, I feel her unique trait from other profs is how you can ask her questions and she will break it down well, keeping your understanding in mind.

Seldomly tell something useful in class. Every course just puts students into the discussion room. There is never a delay in the submission of assignments, submission gap is only open for one hour, and this gap is often changed without reminding. Email reply speed is extremely slow, usually needs a week's wait for her replaying.

Prof. Sharla's a great teacher. She's open and clear about her lectures. She'll definitely clear all the doubts you've got, both academic & personal. But she's kinda unprofessional when it comes to emails and at times she's a tough grader. DON'T EVER TAKE THIS CLASS EASY cuz she wants her students to actually learn something when doing projects.

One of the best instructors FIC has. Her classes are super engaging and she does a really good job of making sure you do not get bored at any point. I would highly recommend taking her courses. Not only will you learn a lot, but they are great GPA boosters too.

Shes really nice and I will take her other classes as well but you need to study hard for her midterms and exams. The group presentation is really important for her so take it seriously and also the lab lecture ls are very important.

So I took this course at FIC. If there's 1 thing I'm sure about her, she is in love with bio! She's very good at explaining, open to ALL SORTS of questions(easy or tough; won't get upset) and answers happily and if she doesn't know the answer, she'll tell you. She really inspired me about nature, conservation and many more. She is really amazing.
Besttt

Super great instructor!!! She always tries her best to support students. Very passionate. Inspire students. She considers us as her children. She hopes that she can do something to change this world become better. Love her so muchhhhhhh !!
Just take a moment to think about it - wow how amazing it is! A very passionate, excited professor who can make you interested in her course. You cant find anyone better than her in FIC.

She is always passionate about what she teaches, unlike a machine. She shares her own life experience as teaching, which makes her unique from others. In the courses, we discussed and learnt together, rather than only me learnt. She doesn't only teach us knowledge but also encourage us to use the knowledge learnt to influence the surrounding world!
Lecturer who really passionate in what she's teaching  Friendly and helpful  Interesting lectures which are very life-changing try your best to have your bio with her if possible

SHARLA IS A WONDERFUL LECTURER, ALWAYS THERE TO EXPLAIN FOR YOU AND TRIES TO MAKE THE COURSE AS EASY AS SHE CAN. JUST DO YOUR LABS AND STUDY HARD.  ALSO IF YOU KNOW ANYONE GOOD IN YOUR CLASS FEEL FREE TO ASK THEM OR ASK SHARLA HERSELF. SHE IS REALLY WONDERFUL. IT COULD BE TOUGH AT TIMES THOUGH AND PARTICIPATION MATTERS.
She is the best teacher Ever  :) I Would like to take course again and again by mam Sharla
she was such a helpful prof and fun field trips in semester!!!! really helpful with answering questios

Awesome professor! Inspires you! Motivates you! You don't even have to open the textbook if you just listen to her in class. Read the slides, understand the material and do you lab. The best course! Teaches you a lot of things!  Super friendly and an amazing prof! She's passionate, cute and a wonderful teacher! Do take it!

Nice prof, can feel her passion in teaching. Midterms are not difficult as long as you participate in classes. Lab sessions are very important because most of the materials tested were from the lab manual.
She is the best prof. I even seen! I like her class and the way she teach!!!

She is enthusiastic for biology and science, and also make every students in her class be enthusiastic for them.if you wanna fall in love in biology, take her course, because you will think the knowledge she taught is very interesting and useful.Her teaching skill is perfect, every questions you asked can be answered specificly by her.
Very cool teacher, makes you want to study and understand, very helpful, and she explains until she makes sure u understand, simply my favorite teacher!!!
THis is my favorite teacher of all time until now. explains perfectly!!

she's very good teacher, she's the kind of teachers that love her subject and with that make you love it too. the exams were tough because the course is kind of heavy. but she explain things well. if you study well you should do good at it!

Mika was a great professor for a 1st year Biology course. He explained things very clearly, his lecture slides wereeasy to understand, and experiments in the lab portion of the course mostly helped elivate understanding of the lecture material. Your grade is based on 2 lab exams and 3 lecture exams. They were non cumulative. Great prof.

Mika is a really good professor and willing to solve students questions. The office hour is super helpful, you will have a fantastic chat with this funny teacher! The exam is not really hard if you memorize concepts and words on lecture slides!!

A very good professor.  He may be boring at times but he was very knowledgeable of the topic and presented it well. The lecture slides and recording are online but trust me it is a lot easier going to class.  As most said, you have to really study hard for this class. you will get a good grade if you really like the topic and work hard.
He is very monotoned, and lectures are extremely boring. THIS CLASS IS NOT A GPA BOOSTER, 2 Midterms are somewhat fair. If you want to do well in this class you have to put an effort.

He is a pretty good prof, yes he does tape it which just makes it better if you can't go.. I always go and find his powerpoints somewhat helpful... but he spends too much time talking about examples that are not testable or in the text.

He knows his stuff but I have no interest in attending class. His voice is kind of monotonous. Also he posts lecture notes AND records the lecture so there's no point in attending class. You'll only do well on the tests if you study because believe it or not, Biology isn't just "memorization". If you take this course, be prepared to put in effort.

I don't know why so few students are participating in "ratemyprofessors.com"  Anyways, this is an excellent prof.  He is fair in his exams and is clear in what he expects for them.  His lectures are taped so you don't need to come to class.  Take him if you can.
nice prof, boring lectures, good powerpoint notes, fair midterms and final... one of those average profs.. not bad
No need come to class at all. His lecture got nothing relevent to the exam.
Great prof, very friendly and funny.
No Comments

hard to listen to since he studders a lot in lectures. but his notes make up for it. if you're good at drawing figures, you won't need the text. the final was weird since nicholson tagged out halfway through the term and the two profs co-wrote the final. they 2 had very different testing methods...

Erin is a really nice lab professor, she really cares about her students and is very thorough in her emails to sends us. She is very helpful when it comes to asking questions about lab stuff and at first, she might not seem good, but you have to work up to her and get used to her teaching environment
great prof,very helpful and lectures are very interesting

Lectures are long and boring, tests are super hard and labs are long and usually don't connect with course at all. Do not buy textbook, all info on powerpoint slides is on tests. She is not organized at all and lectures tend to be all over the place

Overall she's nice and has passion for bio. However too much was crammed in lecture. Her exam hints didnt always appear which sucked as exam questions were extremely vauge. I used the lab prof, TAs and the textbook to pass instead. Mini activities and documentaries were common. She does give opportunities to get bonus marks.
This is a late entry into a course a took more than a year ago. But the professors commitment to change and showing us the biology that we need to know really hit me.

Stay away from this prof. I waited a year to write this to compare to others and its as bad as I thought.  All over the place, talks a mile a minute, ridiculous exercises.  Go along or flunk. Anyone, anyone else. Be warned.

She is my bisc100 lecturer. To be honest, she was caring and kind. However, she speak too fast and that makes you hardly ever can concentrate. She was not organized with what she was teaching. She shorten the lecture, provide useless so-call "activities" which is just making models of cell structure. Her grading was unclear as well.
This course changed my ug direction. Conservative biology nw.
One of the best profs  I have had! I loved her
she didn't know what she was talking about there was no relation between the lectures and labs, it was the worst experience for me ever.

You will have difficulty with this professor if all you do is go to lecture. The material is laid out very well in his notes, but he is not strong at presenting it. Go to tutorials, spend time with your T.A., and invest in the textbook and he will be a breeze. Super nice guy as well, and very funny!

i don't tend to sleep in class but his ideas and train of thought are so scattered that i  wasn't able to keep my eyes open for more than 25 consecutive minutes . His tests were easy and straight forward... He gives old exams that are almost the same as the new ones.  He was confused about H being helium or hydrogen.....

Super nice and funny guy. I have no idea why his rating is so low... His tests were super easy and straight forward... He even gives you old exams and tells you that new ones dont really change LOL I never studied for a test. He does jump around quite a bit during his lectures but hes hilarious and he gives you bonus marks for sending articles in.

I really hated his lectures and therefore him, but reading his lecture notes (which are basically the textbook) instilled in me a deep respect for him... He makes grammatical errors, but his writing is so fluent and coherent... so easy to read and understand!

This is the easiest A+ I've ever gotten in my life! Though there is a lots of text book reading. So, as long as you read the text book, the lecture notes, go to class and do his practice exams before the test, you WILL get an A! He practice exams and actually tests are almost identical. If you have a valid point, he would even give you partial or f
Definitely an awesome prof. tests are very easy.
the course was simple, but some of the material got boring, but if you are a Science student it's not too bad.
lame
